The Obama administration: s 2010 budget called for the elimination of the Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities State Grants program, which would have resulted in a savings of $294 million.
Obama: s budget also requested an additional $100 million for a companion program that distributed grants on a case-by-case basis.
Congress ultimately only added: 51 million to the companion program, resulting in a cut closer to $200 million, not $300 million as claimed by Cruz.
The Safe and Drug: Free Schools program funded a wide range of activities beyond armed guards or security, including working with the Secret Service on identifying students at risk of violence and ensuring schools had emergency management plans.
